additionalTextInformation.text:
Koepplin saw the painting in 1989 and dated it to about 1550 and as such associated it with the later masterpieces by Cranach the Elder created in cooperation with his son. 
[Lempertz online database: https://www.lempertz.com/de/kataloge/lot/856-1/1033-lucas-cranach-d-ae.html; accessed 26-03-2019]

pageContext.description: Christ's corps is laid out on a white cloth. St John supports his torso at the right edge of the image.  Mary Magdalene kneels in the centre, wearing a red robe and kissing Christ's left hand. Behind her are four women in tears with white veils. Right at the front, kneeling closest to Christ is the Virgin Mary. Joseph of Arimathea and Nicodemus are shown at the right hand side, one holding the crown of thorns, while the other grasps the white cloth wrapped around Christ's legs.
